alert.note: Alert for San Mateo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 9:18AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, San Mateo. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM PST, the public and local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding in the advisory area, especially locations such as Moss Beach and Millbrae. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Daly City, San Mateo, South San Francisco, San Bruno, Pacifica, Foster City, Burlingame, Millbrae, Half Moon Bay, Hillsborough, El Granada, Highlands-Baywood Park, Brisbane, Colma, Montara, Moss Beach, Highlands and Broadmoor. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
